bill.title: Office of Hawaiian Affairs; Board of Trustees; Vacancies; Election
bill.description: Amends the deadline to file nomination papers associated with filling a vacancy in the membership of the board of trustees of OHA, to ensure compliance with provisions of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2010, P.L. 111-84, mandating the mailing of absentee ballots to uniformed and overseas voters no later than forty-five days prior to an election.

history.action: (H) Pending introduction.
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to HAW, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by HAW on Wednesday, 02-01-12 8:30AM in House conference room 329.
(H) Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

(H) The committees on HAW recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 8 Ayes: Hanohano, C. Lee, Belatti, Mizuno, Morikawa, Wooley, Pine, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Jordan, Yamane.
(H) Reported from HAW (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 132-12), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
(H) Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Takai excused (1).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 02-14-12 2:05PM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 12 Ayes: Keith-Agaran, Rhoads, Brower, Cabanilla, Herkes, Ito, Luke, Souki, Tsuji, Fontaine, Marumoto, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Carroll, Coffman, McKelvey.
(H) Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 535-12), recommending referral to FIN.
(H) Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Herkes, M. Lee excused (2).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Monday, 02-27-12 10:00AM in House conference room 308.

(H) The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 16 Ayes: Representative(s) Oshiro, M. Lee, Choy, Cullen, Giugni, Har, Hashem, Ichiyama, Jordan, Kawakami, C. Lee, Morikawa, Tokioka, Yamashita, Marumoto, Riviere; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Ward.
(H) Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 896-12), recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 144).
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to HWN/PGM, JDL.
(S) The committee(s) on HWN/PGM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-14-12 2:45PM in conference room 224.

(S) The committee(s) on HWN recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in HWN were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Galuteria, Ryan, Kahele, Kidani, Solomon; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) English, Hee, Slom.

(S) The committee(s) on PGM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PGM were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Kidani, Baker, Ryan; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Slom.
(S) Reported from HWN/PGM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2955) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to JDL.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDL.
(S) The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 03-27-12 10:30AM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Shimabukuro, Gabbard, Ihara, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
(S) Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3150) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading.
(S) One Day Notice 04-04-12.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
(H) Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 469).
(H) Transmitted to Governor.
